context: The word 'jätkame' is the first-person plural present indicative form of the verb 'jätkama', which means 'to continue' or 'to carry on'. It is used when a group (including the speaker) is continuing an activity or process that was previously started. The dictionary also shows related compound words like 'tööjärg' (work sequence), indicating this word belongs to the semantic field of sequences, continuations, and progressions.
